III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & R 400.4159 Youth restraint; pregnant youth; reduction,
Section prevention; prohibited restraints; elimination of restraints.
Description (5) In the event a restraint occurs, it must be performed in a
manner that is safe, appropriate, and proportionate to the severity
of the youth’s behavior, chronological and developmental age,
1

size, gender, physical condition, medical condition, psychiatric
condition, and personal history, including any history of trauma,
and must be done in a manner consistent with the youth’s
treatment plan.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 08/06/2025, a youth engaged in an altercation with another
youth, resulting in a left-hand injury. The youth was restrained by
staff and it is unclear if the injury is from the peer altercation or
from the staff restraint. Medical treatment was sought.
Investigation Interviews
Complainant was interviewed on 08/08/2025 by phone.
Complainant did not have additional information.
Youth A was not interviewed on 08/08/2025 at Wolverine Center
because he was taken to the hospital to evaluate his ankle after
he jumped off the play structure. Youth A was subsequently
interviewed on 08/14/2025 at Wolverine Center. Youth A was
asked about his left thumb being injured in a fight or a physical
management. Youth A stated Staff 1 and Supervisor 1 placed him
in a two-person standing hold when he tried to continue his fight
with another youth. Youth A stated this physical management
occurred outside on the front lawn of the facility as the other youth
was escorted into the facility. Youth A stated his left thumb
“popped out” during his physical management because he is
double jointed. Youth A proceeded to demonstrate by moving his
left thumb up and down at odd angles and using his right hand at
times to push his left thumb in place. Youth A then used his left
hand and pulled aggressively on his right thumb. Youth A stated
his right thumb is almost double jointed. Youth A was redirected to
stop moving and pulling on his thumbs. Youth A laughed in
response and stated his thumbs do not hurt. Youth A stated he
was taken to the hospital after this physical management for
suicidal ideation and his left hand was also evaluated. Youth A
stated the hospital told him that his left thumb was dislocated and
he needed to see a doctor. Youth A stated he did not have
thoughts of self-harm and agreed not to jump off play structures
but did not agree to not pull on his thumbs.
Staff 1 was interviewed on 08/14/2025 at Wolverine Center. Staff
1 stated Youth A was placed in a two-person standing hold by him
and Supervisor 1 when Youth A wanted to continue to fight
another youth. Staff 1 stated he did not recall which side he
secured Youth A on. Staff 1 stated Youth A moved either his right
2

or left thumb up and down after he was released from the standing
hold and Staff 1 pressed Youth A’s right or left hand flat without
incident when Youth A stated his thumb “popped out”. Staff 1
stated Supervisor 1 and Supervisor 2 were the only witnesses to
Youth A’s physical management.
Supervisor 1 was interviewed on 08/14/2025 at Wolverine
Center. Supervisor 1 stated Youth A was separated and physically
managed in a standing two-person hold for approximately one to
two minutes for trying to continue his fight with another youth.
Supervisor 1 stated he secured Youth A from the right side and
Staff 1 secured Youth A from the left side. Supervisor 1 stated
Youth A was released from the hold and stated his left thumb
needed to be pushed back. Supervisor 1 stated Youth A claims he
is double jointed and moves his right and left thumb up and down
in atypical ways. Supervisor 1 stated Youth A was sent to the
hospital following this incident for suicide ideation and to evaluate
his thumb.
Supervisor 2 was interviewed on 08/14/2025 at Wolverine
Center. Supervisor 2 stated she monitored Staff 1 and Supervisor
1’s standing two-person physical management hold of Youth A
when Youth A remained escalated and wanted to continue fighting
a youth. Supervisor 2 stated Youth A was physically managed for
approximately two minutes and the physical management hold
was done properly. Supervisor 2 stated Youth A did not complain
of injury from the physical management but later transported to
the hospital for suicidal ideation. Supervisor 2 stated Youth A says
he is double jointed and shows people how he freely “pops” (move
up and down) his left thumb.
Documentation Reviewed
Restraint incident report dated 08/05/2025 states Youth A was
physically managed in a two-person standing hold from 6:41 PM
to 6:43 PM for fighting another youth. Youth A was de-escalated,
released, and evaluated at the hospital for suicide ideation. Youth
A was not injured.
Youth A does not have a physical management report for
08/06/2025.
Youth A was evaluated on 08/05/2025 for suicide ideation at
Ascension Hospital. Youth A was also evaluated and
recommended for orthopedic follow up per discharge instructions.
3

Youth A’s left thumb was evaluated on 08/15/2025 at Michigan
Hand Specialist. It was recommended for Youth A to wear a cast
and not lift heavy items.
Staff 1 completed Crisis Prevention Institute physical management
training on 03/31/2025. Staff 1 does not have discipline history for
improper restraint.
Supervisor 1 completed Crisis Prevention Institute physical
management training on 02/20/2025. Supervisor 1 does not have
discipline for improper restraint.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance for not injurying Youth A’s left
thumb on 08/05/2025 when he was placed in a standing two-
person physical management hold. It is unknown when or how
Youth A dislocated his left thumb because Youth A believes his
left thumb is double jointed and does not experience pain in his
left thumb.
Conclusion VIOLATION NOT ESTABLISHED
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules.
